findings.title: Implementation contract can be re-initialized via proxy
findings.description: The initialize() function can be called on the proxy if the implementation's `initialized` slot wasn't set. Attacker can re-initialize with malicious parameters.
findings.impact: Complete governance takeover by setting attacker as guardian.
findings.recommendation: Call _disableInitializers() in implementation constructor. Use OZ's Initializable properly.

findings.title: Guardian has unlimited execution power
findings.description: Guardian can execute arbitrary calls without timelock or multi-sig. If guardian is compromised, all funds are at risk.
findings.recommendation: Add timelock for guardian operations. Consider multi-sig requirement.
